newsitem.title: ROMANIA: Romania agency to relaunch selloff of steel maker.
newsitem.headline: Romania agency to relaunch selloff of steel maker.

text.p: Romania's main privatisation agency said on Friday it would relaunch the sell-off of steel maker Otelinox after four bids for a 51 percent stake failed to meet its minimum selling price.

The State Ownership Fund (FPS), the majority shareholder in Romania's sole stainless steel maker, said it would call a new tender for the plant, based in Tirgoviste, 83 km (51 miles) north-east of Bucharest.
"With all four bids below the ask, we will relaunch the privatisation offer, including through an international advertising campaign," FPS spokesman Stefan Ciochinaru said.

Four Western companies -- Ugine, belonging to France's Usinor Sacilor, Samsung Deutschland GmbH and Italy's Stainless Steel International Spa and Finven Spa -- placed bids for the Otelinox stake in a tender earlier this month.
Otelinox has a share capital of around 141 billion lei in shares with a face value of 25,000 lei each.
"The minimum selling price will be maintained at the new tender," Ciochinaru said, declining to give an ask level.
Brokers' community sources said the FPS's was asking 119,000 lei per share -- or the equivalent of over $45 million for the whole package.
FPS bid selection criteria normally include the size of the stake to be purchased, the price offered for that package, further investment plans and environmental protection targets.
Otelinox had a net profit of 7.5 billion lei last year, up from 4.5 billion lei in 1995, which had reversed a 1994 loss of 4.6 billion lei.

The company now trades on the over-the-counter (OTC) market but a local broker said Otelinox would be suspended from OTC trading next week prior to its move to the Bucharest exchange, where it won approval for its listing.
Intermob brokers, who prepared Otelinox' bourse switch, said the company would start bourse trading early in July. ($=7,027 lei)
